text: Peshawar Division () was an administrative division of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan until the reforms of 2000 abolished the third tier of government. At independence in 1947, the North-West Frontier Province (1901–1955) was split into two divisions, Dera Ismail Khan and Peshawar. Until 1976, Peshawar Division contained the districts of Hazara and Kohat, when they both became divisions themselves. ==History== Peshawar Division was originally a district of the North-West Frontier Province (1901–1955) of British India. Later it reverted to Pakistan (1972–2000).Peshawār District – Imperial Gazetteer of India, v. 20, p. 111. The district was administratively subdivided into five tehsils:Peshawār District – Imperial Gazetteer of India, v. 20, p. 117. *Peshawar *Charsadda *Mardan *Swabi *Nowshera After the independence of Pakistan in 1947, the tehsil of Peshawar became the new district of Peshawar. At that time the old district became a division. ==Related pages== * Hazara Division * Kohat Division * Peshawar District == References == Category:Divisions of British India
